Title: Session Management Offered by the Framework Is Used
DirectLink: Session Management Offered by the Framework Is Used

Data:
Applies to

  • Java

What to Check For

Verify that session management offered by the framework is used.

Why

The framework works on a lower level than the application and is therefore better suited to provide session management. Most mature web application frameworks offer secure session management functionality.

How to Check

To verify that session management offered by the framework is used:

  1. Identify session management functionality. Find code that handles session management.

  2. Verify that session management offered by the framework is used. Review code that uses session management to make sure it uses functionality offered by the framework.

How to Fix

To use session management offered by the framework, please refer to the documentation for your chosen framework. Most Java frameworks take advantage of HttpSession objects. Information about using HttpSession objects may be found by following links at the bottom of this page.

Additional Resources

  • For information about Java session management, please see http://inheritingjava.blogspot.com/2011/03/chapter-20-introduction-to-session.html
  • For reference on using the HttpSession class, please see http://download.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/javax/servlet/http/HttpSession.html
  • For a tutorial on session tracking in Java, please see http://www.apl.jhu.edu/~hall/java/Servlet-Tutorial/Servlet-Tutorial-Session-Tracking.html

Java Session Management Guidelines

  • Use Session Management Offered by the Framework
  • Protect Session IDs
  • Protect Session Cookies
  • Set the Domain and Path Values of Session Cookies
  • Set the Secure and HTTPOnly Flags on All Sensitive Cookies
  • Change Session IDs During Authentication
  • Invalidate Sessions when Users Log Out
  • Make Inactive Sessions Time-out
  • Include Unique Tokens in HTTP Requests
  • Do Not Make Security Decisions Based on Client-Accessible Parameters

Java Session Management Checklists

  • Inactive Sessions Time-out
  • Unique Tokens Are Included in HTTP Requests
